__TOC__


Here we have a sampling of bugs to work on for Hug Day.  After you have triaged or fixed a bug put your name in the last column and set the row background to a green color by adding '''lightgreen''' in the first cell of the column after "background-color:" and before ";".  This will let people know that the bug in that row has been worked on.

=== 32 bugs tagged as iso-testing with a New status ===
These bugs were reported by people testing ISO images of development releases of Ubuntu.  They will most likely be dealing with a Gutsy build but may be about Feisty.  In the event the bug is about Feisty you can test it with Gutsy yourself or ask the reporter if it is still an issue with Gutsy ISO images. 
'''To mark it off the list you should:'''
* Ensure that the bug is assigned to a package '''and'''
* Set the bug to "Confirmed" if you can reproduce the issue '''or'''
* Set the bug to "Confirmed" if there is enough information for a developer to work on it '''or'''
* Assign the bug reporter for more information, mark it "Incomplete" and subscribe to the bug report '''or'''
* Search for a bug it is a duplicate of (and mark if found)

=== 50 bugs regarding linux-source-2.6.22 (the kernel for Gutsy Gibbon) with a New status ===
These bugs need to have initial triaging of them completed.  At a minimum all kernel bugs should contain the full output of '''lspci -vvnn''', '''uname -a''', '''cat /proc/version_signature''' and '''dmesg'''.  There are about 378 <nowiki>[[https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/linux-source-2.6.22/+bugs|2.6.22 bugs]]</nowiki> of which 118 are new.

'''To mark it off the list you should:'''
* Ask the reporter for the minimum information for a kernel bug, set it to "Incomplete" and subscribe yourself '''or'''
* Set it "Confirmed", assign it to the proper kernel team and set an importance (if you are not a QA member ask someone for help) '''or'''
* Search for a bug it is a duplicate of (and mark if found)

=== 11 bugs tagged as iso-testing with an Incomplete status ===
These bugs were reported by people testing ISO images of development releases of Ubuntu.  They will most likely be dealing with a Gutsy build but may be about Feisty.  In the event the bug is about Feisty you can test it with Gutsy yourself or ask the reporter if it is still an issue with Gutsy ISO images. 
'''To mark it off the list you should:'''
* Set the status to "Invalid" if the reporter has not provided all the information necessary '''or'''
* Reproduce the bug with the latest daily Gutsy build and set the status to "Confirmed" '''or'''
* Leave the bug "Incomplete" and ask the reporter if it is still an issue with the latest Gutsy build and subscribe to the report
